summary: Rebalances food, alcohol, healing poultices, and skooma to give simple consistency and progression to feel more compelling for PC use.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Georgia][size=3]Food and intoxicants have several improvements in version 2.0.x of [b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281]Requiem - The Oldschool Roleplaying Overhaul[/url][/b], though in some cases there's still inconsistency, lack of compelling usefulness, and a holdover of randomly generated instant death mechanics in skooma. [/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]

Requiem - Food and Drug Rebalance (R-FDR)[/size][/font][/b][/color] is intended to fix those issues, listed in more detail below, while attempting to [size=3]change the least amount necessary from base [b]Requiem[/b] to achieve improved balance, immersion, and (hopefully) fun.[/size]
[/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=5][b]Food[/b][/size][/font]
 
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]New additions to R-FDR 1.3:[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3]
[spoiler][/size][/font]
[color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff]Continuing with the increased beastial changes in [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR 1.2[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font], [/color]Beastial Stews[/color] have been expanded to include variations involving [color=#f9cb9c]Bear Hearts, Sabre Cat Hearts, Horker Fat, Troll Fat[/color], and [color=#f9cb9c]Mammoth Hearts[/color]. Each variant provides different buffs, all lasting 3600 seconds.

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] ([color=#f9cb9c]Wolf[/color]) remains the base [b]Requiem[/b] [color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color], restoring 2 [color=#ffe599]Stamina[/color]/second.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] ([color=#f9cb9c]Bear[/color]) fortifies [color=#ffe599]Health[/color] by 30.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] ([color=#f9cb9c]Sabre Cat[/color]) fortifies [color=#ffe599]Stamina[/color] by 30.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] ([color=#f9cb9c]Horker[/color]) fortifies [color=#ffe599]Carry Weight[/color] by 30.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] ([color=#f9cb9c]Troll[/color]) restores 1 [color=#ffe599]Health[/color]/second.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] ([color=#f9cb9c]Mammoth[/color]) fortifies [color=#ffe599]Carry Weight[/color] by 50.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[color=#ffe599]Beastial Stews[/color] in R-FDR are now only available/visible in the cookpot recipe listing for PCs with a strong stomach.

[/spoiler]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]New additions to R-FDR 1.2:[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]

[spoiler]
[list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]All base [b]Requiem[/b] food items are now integrated and balanced into [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]. For better food continuity, most [color=#ffe599]fruit, vegetables[/color], and [color=#ffe599]water[/color] now fortify [color=#ffe599]Stamina[/color], while [color=#ffe599]tomatoes[/color] fortify [color=#ffe599]Magicka [color=#ffffff]regeneration[/color][/color]. Uncooked [color=#ffe599]vegetables[/color] provide 1800 seconds of minor [color=#ffe599]Fortify Stamina[/color]. Cooked [color=#ffe599]vegetables[/color] provide moderate [color=#ffe599]Fortify Stamina[/color], and [color=#ffe599]vegetable[/color] based soups provide either greater [color=#ffe599]Fortify Stamina[/color] ([color=#ffe599]Cabbage[/color] or [color=#ffe599]Potato [color=#ffffff]soup[/color][/color]), or 1 [color=#ffe599]Stamina[/color]/second restoration ([color=#ffe599]Apple Cabbage, Vegetable[color=#ffffff],[/color] [color=#ffffff]or [/color]Cabbage Potato [color=#ffffff]soup[/color][/color]) all for 3600 seconds. [color=#ffe599]Cheese[/color] slices/wheels, cooked [color=#ffe599]Meats[/color], and [color=#ffe599]Meat[/color] stews fortify [color=#ffe599]Carry Weight[/color] [font=Georgia][size=3]for 3600 seconds[/size][/font], while gourmet cooked [color=#ffe599]meats[/color] and gourmet [color=#ffe599]meat[/color] stews fortify [color=#ffe599]Health[/color] in addition to greater [color=#ffe599]Carry Weight[/color] buffs [font=Georgia][size=3]for 3600 seconds[/size][/font]. [/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]A gourmet cooking mechanic is now added to [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]. This requires having a copy of the book [color=#ffe599]Uncommon Taste[/color] in the PC inventory as a cookbook reference, which opens up several gourmet cooking options with greater buffs when using a [color=#ffe599]cooking pot[/color]. This solves the oftentime made player complaint that food in base [b]Requiem[/b] is too expensive when compared to the cost of purchasing the Whiterun[/size][/font] player home. Vendors don't sell gourmet food, so a PC will no longer see extremely high food prices sold by NPCs. Now [color=#ffe599]Meats[/color] and [color=#ffe599]Stews[/color] sold in taverns (and always available to be cooked by the PC) are inexpensive and provide moderate [color=#ffe599]Carry Weight[/color] buffs. In order to cook foods with greater buffs (similar to the buff for [color=#ffe599]Beef Stew[/color] in base [b]Requiem[/b]), the PC must cook -and be able to cook- gourmet foods.
[/list][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3]
[list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]Gourmet meal variations now include [color=#ffe599]Boar, Beef, Chicken, Goat Leg, Horker, Mudcrab Legs, Pheasant, Rabbit, Salmon, Venision[/color], and all vanilla [color=#ffe599]meat[/color] based stews (except [color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color]). Non-gourmet [color=#ffe599]meat[/color] based stew recipes no longer require expensive or rare alchemy ingredients, but provide lesser buffs for 3600 seconds. [font=Georgia][size=3]Gourmet [color=#ffe599]meat[/color] based stew recipes now require the better respective alchemy ingredients from the base [b]Requiem[/b] variations, and provide strong buffs [font=Georgia][size=3]for 3600 seconds[/size][/font].[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list]﻿[list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] is now more beastial. [color=#ffe599]Raw Meat [color=#ffffff]and[/color] Salmon[/color] in it's recipe are replaced by [color=#ffe599]Bone Meal [color=#ffffff]and[/color] Salt[/color], while the [color=#ffe599]Jug of Milk[/color] and [color=#ffe599]Wolf Heart[/color] requirement remains the same. This fits [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] food ingredient type buff continuity better since [color=#ffe599]Beastial Stew[/color] has the best [color=#ffe599]Stamina[/color] regen buff of all foods (2 [color=#ffe599]Stamina[/color]/second for base [b]Requiem[/b]), though no [color=#ffe599]Carry Weight[/color] buff.[/size][/font]
[/list]﻿[list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Steamed Mudcrab Legs[/color] no longer require [color=#ffe599]Butter[/color], and use [color=#ffe599]Salt[/color] instead.[/size][/font]
[/list]﻿[list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] adds food records from Dragonborn DLC (since they show up in mainland Skyrim now anyway): [color=#ffe599]Boar Meat[/color] and [color=#ffe599]Cooked Boar Meat[/color], with Requiem based food values.[/size][/font]
[/list]
[/spoiler]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffffff][size=5]Food[/size][/color]
[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][size=3]In base [b]Requiem[/b][/size][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font], most food buffs have their durations drastically reduced from 7200 seconds (in [/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][b]Requiem 1.9.4.1[/b]) to 1800 seconds (currently in [b]2.0.1[/b]). Some reduction could work well to create a sense of hunger, but this[/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3] severity creates tedium in how frequently the PC needs to farm/slaughter/buy and recook ingredients for decent food buffs early to mid-game.
[/size][/font]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font] increases general food buff durations to 3600 seconds, giving a less severe sense of benefiting from eating [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]regularly[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font].[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][size=3]In base [b]Requiem[/b][/size][/size][/font] 2.0.1, [color=#ffe599]Beef Stew[/color] [/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]inexplicably and [/size][/font][/size][/font]uniquely provides the PC a combined fortify +50 [color=#ffe599]Health[/color] buff and a +25[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] [color=#ffe599][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Fortify [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]Carry Weight[/color] buff, both for 1800 seconds. No other stew or meat provides[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] anything resembling this. [color=#ffe599]Braided Bread[/color] also [/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]inexplicably [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]provides the PC a [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]+10 [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Fortify Carry Weight buff for 1800 seconds. No other [color=#ffe599]bread, cheese, meat[/color], or other food other than [color=#ffe599]Beef Stew[/color] has any sort of buff like this. This makes base [b]Requiem[/b] food overall feel [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]arbitrary, and gives little incentive to carry around or eat most foods[b].[/b][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3] [/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff]All[/color] bread, cheese, [color=#ffffff]and[/color] cooked meats[/color] in [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font] provide small to moderate [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Fortify Carry Weight[/color] buffs for 3600 seconds: [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff]All [/color]bread [color=#ffffff]and[/color] cheese[/color] now fortify between +5 and +10 carry weight depending on their size. [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599][color=#ffffff]All ﻿[/color]cooked meats[/color] now carry a graduated range of Fortify [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Carry Weight buffs. Overall, Ogerboss and the [b]Requiem[/b] team did a great job balancing alcohol for 2.0.x, so there's not much changed here. The changes made here are mainly to piggyback onto Healing Poultices.[/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3]
Wine and Alto Wine have two bottle variants of each in base [b]Skyrim[/b]. [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] makes the naked glass bottle variants slightly less strong than the wicker woven covered variants, though the prices and buffs/debuffs are similar to the default values for those items in base [font=Georgia][size=3][b]Requiem[/b], and are renamed as follows[/size][/font]:

[*][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3]Alto Wine (good)[font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][color=#ffffff]: [font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][color=#ffffff]24 gold, 50/-30 alcohol buff/debuff.[/color][/size][/color][/font][/color][/size][/color][/font][/size][/color][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3]Alto Wine (remarkable)[font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][color=#ffffff]:[/color][/size][/color][/font][/size][/color][/font][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][color=#ffffff] 28 gold, 75/-30 alcohol buff/debuff [font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][color=#ffffff][font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3][color=#ffffff](same as base [font=Georgia][size=3][b]Requiem[/b][/size][/font] 2.0.1)[/color][/size][/color][/font][/color][/size][/color][/font][/size][/color][/font].[/color][/size][/color][/font]

[size=5][b]Healing Poultices[/b][/size]

Healing Poultices in [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] now come in five variants, and are all made at a tanning rack. The Healing Poultice recipe note has been updated to both allow the crafting of these variants, and to give an accurate overview of how to produce them:

[spoiler]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice (deficient)[/color]: standard base [b]Requiem[/b] Healing Poultice strength. 10 gold, made with [color=#ffe599]Ale [color=#ffffff]or[/color] Nord Mead[/color], and 1 of each of the standard alchemy ingredients (Tundra Cotton and Blue Mountain Flower).[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice (faint)[/color]: 1.5x[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] base [b]Requiem[/b] [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Healing Poultice[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] strength. 15 gold, made with [font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3]Wine (faint)[/size][/color][/font], and 2 of [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]each of the [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]standard[/size][/font][/size][/font] alchemy ingredients.[/size][/font][/size][/font][*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice (fair)[/color]: 2x[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] base [b]Requiem[/b] [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Healing Poultice[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] strength. 20 gold, made with [font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3]Wine (fair)[/size][/color][/font], and 2 of [/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font]
[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]each of the [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]standard[/size][/font][/size][/font] alchemy ingredients.[/size][/font][/size][/font][*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice (good)[/color]: [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]3x[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] base [b]Requiem[/b] [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Healing Poultice[/size][/font][/size][/font] strength. 30 gold, made with [font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3]Alto Wine (good)[/size][/color][/font], and 3 of[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] each of the [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]standard[/size][/font][/size][/font] alchemy ingredients.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice (remarkable)[/color]: [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]4x[font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] base [b]Requiem[/b] [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]Healing Poultice[/size][/font][/size][/font] strength. 35 gold, made with [font=Georgia][color=#ffe599][size=3]Alto Wine (remarkable)[/size][/color][/font], and 4 of[/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3] each of the [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3]standard[/size][/font][/size][/font] alchemy ingredients.[/size][/font][/size][/font]
[/list][font=Georgia][size=3][/spoiler]
A PC is no longer restricted to only finding/buying [color=#ffe599]Ale[/color] to make [color=#ffe599]Healing Poultices[/color], and the various alcohols are relatively common. This introduces a greater incentive for a PC to prophylactically use a [color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice[/color] early to mid game each time they go exploring to help Healing and Regeneration Potions be more effective, and to have a better chance of survival between battles, especially with the higher quality types.

No leveled lists are changed in this mod, so NPCs will still only carry the [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice (deficient)[color=#ffffff]. This[/color][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font] can be explained by the various forms of [color=#ffe599]Wine[/color] being more expensive than [font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Ale [color=#ffffff]or[/color] Nord Mead[/color][/size][/font][/size][/font], and commoners/bandits aren't going to have extra money and resources to throw around for such things when a low level [font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Healing Poultice[/color][/size][/font] heals just as completely with some rest. Who in Skyrim would waste the good stuff on healing when they can drink it?


[size=5][b]Skooma[/b][/size]

[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#e69138][b][font=Georgia][size=3]R-FDR[/size][/font][/b][/color][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font][/size][/font] modifies the rare random number generated instant death for [color=#ffe599]Skooma[/color] and turns it into a rare survivable overdose scenario, which can also now be totally avoided if a PC has a high enough Poison Resistance. [/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3]The language used to describe [color=#ffe599]Skooma[/color] is a little more concise, and the visual effects now last as long as all buff/debuff effects are still present. [color=#ffe599][/color][/size][/font]
[*][font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Redwater Skooma[/color] now additionally has the effects of base [font=Georgia][size=3][b]Requiem[/b][/size][/font] [color=#ffe599]Skooma[/color], but maintains it's much shorter lasting effect time - only as long as the base [b]Skyrim[/b] [font=Georgia][size=3][color=#ffe599]Redwater Skooma[/color][/size][/font] effects.[/size][/font]
[/list]

files.name: Requiem - Food and Drug Rebalance 1.2
files.changelogHtml:
4/28/2018:

All base Requiem food items are now integrated and balanced into R-FDR. Most fruit, vegetables, and water now fortify Stamina, while tomatos fortify Magicka regeneration. Uncooked vegetables provide 1800 seconds of minor Fortify Stamina. Cooked Vegetables provide moderate Fortify Stamina, and Vegetable based soups provide either greater Fortify Stamina (Cabbage, Potato), or 1 Stamina/second restoration (Apple Cabbage, Vegetable, Cabbage Potato) for 3600 seconds. Cheeses and cooked Meats and Meat stews fortify Carry Weight, while Gourmet cooked Meats and Gourmet Meat stews Fortify Health in addition to greater Carry Weight buffs.

A gourmet cooking mechanic is added to Requiem. This requires having a copy of the book Uncommon Taste in the PC inventory as a cookbook reference, which opens up several gourmet cooking options with greater buffs when using a cooking pot. This solves the oftentime made player complaint that food in Requiem is too expensive when compared to the cost of purchasing the Whiterun player home. Vendors don't sell gourmet food, so a PC will no longer see extremely high food prices sold by NPCs (other than fondue). Now Meats and Stews sold in taverns (and always available to be cooked by the PC) are inexpensive, and provide moderate Carry Weight buffs. In order to cook foods with greater buffs (similar to the buff for Beef Stew in base Requiem), the PC must cook -and be able to cook- gourmet foods.

Gourmet meal variations now include Boar, Beef, Chicken, Goat Leg, Horker, Mudcrab Legs, Pheasant, Rabbit, Salmon, Venision, and all vanilla Meat based Stews (except Beastial stew).

Beastial Stew is more beastial. Raw Meat and Salmon are replaced by Bone Meal and Salt, while the Jug of Milk and Wolf Heart requirement remains the same. This fits food ingredient continuity better since Beastial Stew has the best Stamina regen buff of all foods (2 Stamina/second for base Requiem), though no Carry Weight buff.

Steamed Mudcrab Legs no longer require Butter, and use Salt instead.

Added food records from Dragonborn DLC (since they show up in mainland Skyrim now anyway): Boar Meat and Cooked Boar Meat, with Requiem based food values.

files.name: Requiem - Food and Drug Rebalance MA patch
files.fileName: Requiem - Food and Drug Rebalance MA patch-90714-1.7z

files.name: Requiem - Food and Drug Rebalance 1.3
files.changelogHtml:
5/4/2018:

Beastial Stews have been expanded to include variations involving Bear Hearts, Sabre Cat Hearts, Horker Fat, Troll Fat, and Mammoth Hearts. Each variant provides different buffs as listed below, all lasting 3600 seconds.

Beastial Stew (Wolf) remains the base Requiem Beastial Stew, restoring 2 Stamina/second.
Beastial Stew (Bear) fortifies Health by 30.
Beastial Stew (Sabre Cat) fortifies Stamina by 30.
Beastial Stew (Horker) fortifies Carry Weight by 30.
Beastial Stew (Troll) restores 1 Health/second.
Beastial Stew (Mammoth) fortifies Carry Weight by 50.

Beastial Stews in R-FDR are only available/visible in the cookpot recipe listing for PCs with a strong stomach.
